title: travis: ignored warnings from ssh - make no sense to me (point to real problem?)
body:
Looking at https://travis-ci.org/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/692911531 failures I spotted:

https://travis-ci.org/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/692911531#L1711

```
All 517 tests passed (36.34s)
ok
(recording state in git...)
.channel 22: open failed: administratively prohibited: open failed
..Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/datalad_temp__test_bare_git_version_1v8uhzvbx/042/3e394-a290-11ea-954b-42010a14002f'...
done.
channel 22: open failed: administratively prohibited: open failed
.Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/datalad_temp__test_bare_git_version_10280cwhq/09c/8ad2a-a290-11ea-954b-42010a14002f'...
done.
.Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/datalad_temp__test_bare_git_version_2ybzj9pw3/0bb/13530-a290-11ea-954b-42010a14002f'...
done.
channel 22: open failed: administratively prohibited: open failed
.Cloning into bare repository '/tmp/datalad_temp__test_bare_git_version_298_ktgo7/11b/789a2-a290-11ea-954b-42010a14002f'...
done.
.Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.7.1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/datalad/resources/procedures/cfg_yoda.py", line 39, in <module>
    [s['path'] for s in dirty]
RuntimeError: Stopping, because to be modified dataset content was found dirty: ['/tmp/datalad_temp_tree_test_dirtybk5v8eg8/README.md']
......................................S......S.....S...............................................................SS...................S.SSSSSS..........................S................................S............S...................................S...............................CommandError: 'ssh -o ControlPath=/home/travis/.cache/datalad/sockets/137d6117 localhost 'export "PATH=/usr/lib/git-annex.linux:$PATH"; exit 42'' failed with exitcode 42
...ssh: Could not resolve hostname localhost: Name or service not known
```

- `channel 22: open failed: administratively prohibited: open failed` -- what are we trying to do what is prohibited?
- `ssh: Could not resolve hostname localhost: Name or service not known`.  - we do use localhost in the tests  (as well as `datalad-test`) and I expect it to be defined on travis, otherwise more tests should have failed... 

so what are those about really? may be relates to our stalling with newer annexes #4499 ?
